intro: Sphenogyne leucanthemoides, commonly known as the white leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a single head, surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves. Its botanical features include a herbaceous stem and opposite leaf arrangement. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
